page.title: 09Colvend: Farming
page.content: There are five farms in the area. Glenstocken and Boreland each have over 100 dairy cows, mostly Friesians, but with a few Ayrshires.West Barcloy and East Barcloy raise beef cattle, mainly Galloways, Friesians and Herefords. Thorniehill is no longer a working farm but lets out its fields to other farmers for grazing. The beef cattle stay out all year but the cows are brought inside from October to March. In the winter the farmers buy in up to 200 sheep to eat the grass. Boreland has some sheep all the year round and in Spring there are usually about 150 lambs. For feeding,the farmers grow grass for silage, and hay. Silage is mown grass, chopped and wrapped up tightly to keep the air out. The first cut is in June and the second in August.
